body_html: If the decorator is supposed to return that checks the _tracing flag before it goes on to check inputs, and then dispatches to the main implementation then the overhead should be negligible (especially compared to the improvement in readability). I don't think we're using non-standard data structures a lot

I don't think we're using non-standard data structures a lot
body: If the decorator is supposed to return that checks the `_tracing` flag before it goes on to check inputs, and then dispatches to the main implementation then the overhead should be negligible (especially compared to the improvement in readability). I don't think we're using non-standard data structures a lot
